message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. TH2 cells play a key role in allergic reactions, and they secrete IL-4 to stimulate B-cell class switching to IgE. Therefore, the correct answer is (B) IL-4. IFN-gamma is secreted by TH1 cells and is involved in the immune response to viral and bacterial infections. IL-17 is secreted by TH17 cells and plays a role in the immune response to fungal and bacterial infections, as well as in inflammatory and autoimmune diseases. TGF-beta is involved in the regulation of cell growth, differentiation, and apoptosis, and has a variety of roles in the immune system.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only IL-4 is known to stimulate B-cell class switching to IgE in response to allergens. IFN-gamma is secreted by TH1 cells and plays a role in cell-mediated immunity, while IL-17 is secreted by Th17 cells and is involved in inflammation. TGF-beta is a regulatory cytokine involved in immune tolerance.
We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, IL-4 is the factor secreted by TH2 cells that leads to B-cell class switching to IgE.

We refer to PubMed articles on allergy for help. IL-4 is the main cytokine responsible for promoting B-cell class switching to IgE in response to allergen exposure. IFN-gamma and IL-17 are involved in Th1 and Th17 responses, respectively, while TGF-beta plays a role in immune tolerance.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only IL-4 can stimulate B-cell class switching to IgE in response to an allergen. IFN-gamma is a Th1 cell cytokine, IL-17 is secreted by Th17 cells, and TGF-beta can lead to regulatory T cell differentiation.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, IL-4 is the cytokine secreted by TH2 cells that stimulates B-cell class switching to IgE. The other cytokines listed do not have this specific function.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The TH2 cells secrete IL-4 which stimulates B-cell class switching to IgE, leading to an allergic response. IFN-gamma and IL-17 are produced by TH1 and TH17 cells respectively, while TGF-beta has a role in regulatory T-cell development.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The TH2 cell secretes IL-4, which is responsible for class switching to IgE and is involved in allergic reactions. IFN-gamma is secreted by TH1 cells and is involved in cell-mediated immunity. IL-17 is secreted by TH17 cells and is involved in autoimmune and inflammatory diseases. TGF-beta has a wide range of functions including immune suppression and wound healing.
We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only IL-4 is responsible for B cell class switching to IgE in response to allergens.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only IL-4 is known to stimulate B-cell class switching to IgE in response to allergens. IFN-gamma suppresses TH2 cells, IL-17 is associated with inflammatory processes, and TGF-beta has immunosuppressive effects.
